dense¶

functional_api¶

A module to learn and predict dense descriptors.

Can be used to create ml-based filters for image analysis and patch extraction.

create_bag_dataset(projfolder, outfolder, vocabulary, level, psize, verbose=2)¶

Predict bof on an entire slide dataset.

fit_on_image(image, vocabulary, psize, spl_per_image)¶

Fit vocabulary on a single image.

fit_on_imbatch(images, vocabulary, psize, spl_per_image)¶

Fit vocabulary on a batch of images.

fit_on_slide(ptc_folder, vocabulary, voclen, psize, spl_per_image)¶

Create a texture vocabulary.

Parameters

  • ptc_folder (-) – str, path to an image folder.

  • psize (-) – int, size of window in pixels.

  • dictlen (-) – int, number of words in vocabulary.

  • verbose (-) – int, verbosity.

learn_bags(bagdataset, outfolder, bagvoclen, psize, level, verbose=2)¶

Learn expressions from a dataset of bags.

learn_vocabulary(projfolder, outfolder, level, psize=8, voclen=256, spl_per_image=100, slide_data_lim=100, verbose=2, reassignment_ratio=0.0)¶

Fit vocabulary on a single entire slide dataset.

predict_image_bag(image, vocabulary, psize)¶

Predict vocabulary on a single image.

predict_imfolder_bags(imfolder, vocabulary, psize)¶

Predict vocabulary on slide patches.

sample_img(image, psize, spl_per_image)¶

Fit vocabulary on a single image.

shuffle(x)¶

Modify a sequence in-place by shuffling its contents.

This function only shuffles the array along the first axis of a multi-dimensional array. The order of sub-arrays is changed but their contents remains the same.

Parameters

x (array_like) – The array or list to be shuffled.

Returns

Return type

None

Examples

>>> arr = np.arange(10)
>>> np.random.shuffle(arr)
>>> arr
[1 7 5 2 9 4 3 6 0 8] # random

Multi-dimensional arrays are only shuffled along the first axis:

>>> arr = np.arange(9).reshape((3, 3))
>>> np.random.shuffle(arr)
>>> arr
array([[3, 4, 5], # random
       [6, 7, 8],
       [0, 1, 2]])

Module contents¶

shuffle(x)¶

Modify a sequence in-place by shuffling its contents.

This function only shuffles the array along the first axis of a multi-dimensional array. The order of sub-arrays is changed but their contents remains the same.

Parameters

x (array_like) – The array or list to be shuffled.

Returns

Return type

None

Examples

>>> arr = np.arange(10)
>>> np.random.shuffle(arr)
>>> arr
[1 7 5 2 9 4 3 6 0 8] # random

Multi-dimensional arrays are only shuffled along the first axis:

>>> arr = np.arange(9).reshape((3, 3))
>>> np.random.shuffle(arr)
>>> arr
array([[3, 4, 5], # random
       [6, 7, 8],
       [0, 1, 2]])
